message.content:
cs.CG, cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.GR, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with optimization problems related to unit disks, which are a common topic in computational geometry (cs.CG). The first problem discussed is the computation of shortest-path trees in unit disk graphs, which is a fundamental problem in graph theory and algorithms (cs.DS). The second problem is the minimum-separation problem, which involves finding the minimum number of disks needed to retain in order to ensure that any curve connecting two points outside the disks intersects some of the retained disks. This problem can be seen as a variant of set cover, which is a classic problem in discrete mathematics (cs.DM). The paper also presents an algorithmic implementation of the two problems, which involves data structures and computational geometry techniques (cs.GR). Finally, the paper discusses experimental results and practical applications of the algorithms, which are relevant to the field of scientific computing (cs.SI).
